This is a video series on setting up Job Book. 
If you are coming to this series from the middle, 
I recommend starting at the beginning, 
as each video builds on the last.

In the previous section, 
I showed you how to set up Labour Cost Items in Job Book. 
I also mentioned two additional 
line-item collections: 
Equipment and Materials Line Items, 
and Fixed Price Line Items.

In this section, 
we’ll look at how to create Equipment and Materials in the 
Job Book system.

Before we can record Equipment and Materials usage, 
we need to create some Equipment and Materials Line Items in the system.
Let’s hop into it and do just that.

From the dashboard, click the Navigate button in the top-left corner.

Then click on Administration.

Then click on Equipment and Materials.

This is the Item List, 

We'll talk more about this shortly.


But first,
click the Create button.

The fields for Equipment and Materials items are almost identical to those for Labour Cost Items. 

The only difference is that Equipment and Materials items do not include the Hourly Cost field.

Let’s enter the name of your 
equipment or material. 
We’ll CREATE an equipment ITEM
and call it

'Robotic Total Station.'

The next field is 'Accounting Code.' 
Let’s use 4000 as an example. 
Recal this code should match the one used by your accounting system.

Note the Accounting Code is not required 
so if you don't know your accounting code it's not a big deal.

The next field is 'Category.' 
We’ll create 'Equipment' as the category.

The next field is 'Unit.' 
It defaults to 'hours', 
but you can change it
to any unit that 
makes sense for your item, 
such as 
'Days',
'Per
'Unit',
You can even create Units not on the list like 'Bundles.'

We'll select hours in this example.

The next field is 'Unit Cost.' 
Let’s set that to $50. 
This represents 
the cost per selected unit 
for example, per hour or per item.

The last two checkboxes are 'Tax Exempt' and 'Active.'

The tax-exempt checkbox is used to make the item tax-exempt, if applicable. 

The active checkbox is selected by default. 

Just like other line items, 
you can only delete an Equipment and Material ITEM 
if it hasn't been used yet. 

If it has been used, 
you’ll need to deactivate it by unchecking the 'Active' checkbox.

When you click the Save button, 
the item will be created in the Job Book system.
--CLICK SAVE--
Don’t worry, 
if you need to change something, 
you can always edit the item later.

As you can see, our new Equipment and Materials item is now displayed on the item list.

You can see:

the category, 
the name, 
the accounting code, 
the unit, 
and the unit cost.

You can edit the item by clicking on the pencil icon on the far right.

Now I’m going to create a few more Equipment and Materials Line Items.

We’ll use these later in THIS Job Book Setup Guide, 
as well as in the Job Book How to Use Guide.

Feel free to pause the video and create your OWN 
Equipment and Materials Line Items.

---END---

As you can see, I’ve now created several Equipment and Materials items.

These items can now be used when creating jobs in the Job Book system.

You might have even noticed I changed the Accounting Code for Robotic Total Station

To learn more about creating jobs, 
check out our Job Book 
How to Use Guide 
or follow the link in the video description below.

So how are Equipment and Materials Line Items used in the Job Book system?

As COVERED in the Line Items video 
in the Job Book 
Setup Guide, 
Equipment and Materials items are typically used when staff fill out their daily work records. 

They may also be used by administrators when creating invoices based on time and materials used on a job.

In the next video, I’ll show you how to set up Fixed Price Line Items in Job Book.

In the upcoming videos, we’ll look at how to set up Expense Items.

Thanks for watching

and I'll see you in the next video!
